fidelity_criteria.criterion: Reward for accurately documenting that the patient reports feeling essentially the same after the dose increase, with only a possible slight increase in energy
Reward for including the clinician's advice to monitor for hyper-thyroid symptoms such as palpitations or increased sweating
Reward for correctly recording that the patient takes levothyroxine 88 mcg on an empty stomach in the morning and atorvastatin 20 mg at night, separated from levothyroxine
Reward for listing current medications with their exact dosages as shown in the chart (levothyroxine 88 mcg, atorvastatin 20 mg)
Penalize for introducing symptoms, medication changes, instructions, or other clinical details that were not stated in the transcript or present in the chart
Penalize for omitting any of the explicitly discussed counseling or medication-timing details (morning empty-stomach dosing, nighttime atorvastatin, watch for palpitations/sweating)

appropriateness_criteria.criterion: Reward for documenting an evidence-based plan to re-check thyroid function (TSH) within about 6–8 weeks after the levothyroxine dose adjustment
Penalize for absence of any follow-up or monitoring plan for thyroid function after the recent dose increase
Reward for providing correct safety counseling that levothyroxine should be taken on an empty stomach 30–60 minutes before food and separated from atorvastatin or other medications by several hours
Penalize for giving incorrect or unsafe dosing instructions for levothyroxine (e.g., advising intake with food or at the same time as atorvastatin)
